snippet: The administration made its position clear after Congress passed a bill to block Iran’s nominee, who participated in the 1979 Tehran hostage crisis.
abstract: Obama administration says it will deny visa to Hamid Aboutalebi, Iranian diplomat nominated as United Nations ambassador; decision, made during period of delicate talks over Iran's nuclear program, follows political tempest over Aboutalebi's involvement in the 1979-81 Iran hostage crisis.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Mark Landler reported from Washington, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Thomas Erdbrink contributed reporting from Tehran, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: The administration made its position clear after Congress passed a bill to block Iran’s nominee, who participated in the 1979 Tehran hostage crisis.

headline.main: U.S. Says Iran’s Pick for U.N. Envoy Won’t Get a Visa
headline.print_headline: U.S. Says Iran’s Pick for U.N. Envoy Won’t Get a Visa
